podcast_summary: Devin, who was released from prison, is working hard to get her life back on track. She has been applying for jobs and wants to become fully independent. She also plans to gain custody of her child and be a responsible mother. Devin is focused on breaking the generational cycle of violence and trauma and wants to be an advocate and writer. She believes in the power of love but wants to prioritize her independence and personal growth before pursuing romantic relationships. Devin reflects on the changes she has made since her past experiences with alcoholism and is determined to lead a better life. She also discusses the challenges of reentry after being in prison and the importance of mental health. While she hasn't listened to the podcast about her story, she finds participating in it therapeutic and believes it can help raise awareness about domestic abuse. The podcast provides an update on other cases of women who have committed crimes against their abusers, emphasizing the need for vigilance in identifying and addressing domestic abuse.

podcast_guest.name: Kelly Corrigan
podcast_guest.summary: Kelly Corrigan (born August 16, 1967) is an American writer. She is a graduate of the University of Richmond and received a Masters in Literature from San Francisco State University. She is the host of Exactly, a 2017 series where top thinkers take on big ideas. Season One's guests included Margaret Atwood, Walter Isaacson, BJ Novak, Jason Segel and John Cleese. She is also the host of Kelly Corrigan Wonders, a Public Radio series, originating from WHYY in Philadelphia, that ponders “the big questions” with guests like Melinda Gates. She is the host in the interview show Tell Me More With Kelly Corrigan which premiered in October, 2020 on PBS and has had, as of May 1, 2021, three episodes with activist Bryan Stevenson (Ep. 1), entertainer James Corden (Ep. 2) and actress Jennifer Garner (Ep. 3).
